questions.question: Which device operates at the Physical layer and simply repeats signals?
questions.explanation: A hub operates at the Physical layer and broadcasts signals to all connected devices.

questions.question: Which device operates at the Data Link layer and uses MAC addresses?
questions.explanation: A switch operates at the Data Link layer and forwards frames based on MAC addresses.

questions.question: Which device operates at the Network layer and connects different networks?
questions.explanation: A router operates at the Network layer and routes packets between different networks using IP addresses.

questions.question: Which device connects a computer to a network?
questions.explanation: A Network Interface Card connects a computer to a network and provides a physical interface.

questions.question: Which device converts digital signals to analog and vice versa?
questions.explanation: A modem modulates and demodulates signals for transmission over telephone or cable lines.

questions.question: Which device provides wireless network connectivity?
questions.explanation: A wireless access point allows wireless devices to connect to a wired network.

questions.question: Which device filters network traffic based on security rules?
questions.explanation: A firewall monitors and controls network traffic based on predefined security rules.

questions.question: Which device connects two similar network segments at the Data Link layer?
questions.explanation: A bridge connects network segments and filters traffic based on MAC addresses.

questions.question: Which device translates between different network protocols?
questions.explanation: A gateway operates at multiple layers and translates between different protocol architectures.

questions.question: Which device amplifies and regenerates signals over long distances?
questions.explanation: A repeater regenerates weakened signals to extend network range without amplifying noise.
